meanings.definition: A promise to appear in court
meanings.sent1: After signing the recognizance, he knew he had to go to court.
meanings.sent2: The judge released him on his own recognizance.
meanings.sent3: The recognizance was like a ticket to a show he didn't want to attend.
meanings.sent4: Her recognizance hung over her head like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The recognizance was a looming deadline he couldn't ignore.

meanings.definition: An obligation or duty to fulfill a promise or agreement
meanings.sent1: She felt the weight of recognizance to keep her promise.
meanings.sent2: He took on the recognizance of caring for his sick grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The recognizance to finish her homework felt like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent4: The recognizance to be a good friend was always on her mind.
meanings.sent5: The recognizance to be honest with herself was a constant reminder.
